required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post-surgical Outcomes Measure Using the ERAS Protocol for Posterior Cervical Decompression and Fusion
clinical_study.official_title: Post-surgical Outcomes Measure Using the ERAS Protocol for Posterior Cervical Decompression and Fusion

brief_summary.textblock: This research study is being conducted to help improve the pre-operative, intra-operative, and post-operative course for patients and enhance recovery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Will record length of stay in days 3 months following admission date.
primary_outcome.description: We will record the length of stay (date of admission to date of discharge) for the operative admission at the time of discharge.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately before, immediately after, and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Numerical score of neck pain. Scored 0 to 10. 10 is the worst pain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately before, immediately after, and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: SF-12 short form health survey. Scored 0 to 100. 100 is the highest level of health.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately before, immediately after, and 3 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: questionnaire regarding low back pain. Scored 0 to 100. 100 being most severe disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of sessions with physical therapy and occupational therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: will record number of physical and occupational therapy sessions during surgical admission 3 months following admission date
secondary_outcome.description: record of number of sessions completed with physical or occupational therapy during the operative admission. We will determine this number at the time of discharge. We will calculate this number only once.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: will record discharge disposition 3 months following surgical admission date
secondary_outcome.description: We will determine the disposition status at the time of discharge following the operative admission. We will do this only once.

study_pop.textblock: Adults scheduled to undergo posterior cervical spinal fusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 to 89
- Diagnosis of cervical myelopathy, cervical stenosis, cervical disc disorder, or cervical spondylolisthesis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cervical injury as the indication for surgery
- Emergent surgery
